page.title: 16 Radcot area housing
page.content: No new house construction is allowed in this area. One new bungalow was built last year, only possible because it replaced a prefabricated dwelling. The 7 farmhouses are all very old Cotswold stone buildings. 8 farm cottages are still in use by farmers' families or by farm workers, but there are 4 that are empty, becoming derelict. 3 separate pairs of cottages have been sold and converted into detatched houses, in 2 cases these are just weekend homes. It is assumed this will happen to those empty at present. There are only 4 other properties; an old cottage by the bridges, the Swan Inn,the Lock-keepers house and the old manor. Radcot House is a beautiful old Elizabethan building with attractive gables. One Cotswold stone barn is at present undergoing conversion.
